panels.description: container_cpu_usage_seconds_total which gives you how long the CPU has been occupied. 1s = a single Core for a whole second.
panels.title: CPU Utilization [ Min / Avg / Max ]

panels.description: container_cpu_usage_seconds_total which gives you how long the CPU has been occupied. 1s = a single Core for a whole second.
panels.title: CPU Utilization [  User / Kernel ]

panels.description: hot:  The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,  dirty memory, and kernel memory.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: hot:  The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,  dirty memory, and kernel memory.
panels.title: Memory Usage

panels.description: This value counts the number of I/O requests that have been issued to the device driver but have not yet completed. It does not include I/O requests that are in the queue but not yet issued to the device driver
panels.title: I/O Throughput (Filesystem)

panels.description: Contains the number of 512-bytes sectors read and written by the processes member of the cgroup, device by device.
panels.title: Sectors Written

panels.description: Contains the number of 512-bytes sectors read and written by the processes member of the cgroup, device by device.
panels.title: Sectors Read

panels.description:
read_time & write_time:
These values count the number of milliseconds that I/O requests have waited on this block device. If there are multiple I/O requests waiting, these values will increase at a rate greater than 1000/second; for example, if 60 read requests wait for an average of 30 ms, the read_time field will increase by 60*30 = 1800.
panels.title: Tiime spent in I/O

panels.description:
io_time:
This value counts the number of milliseconds during which the device has had I/O requests queued.

weighted_io_time:
This value counts the number of milliseconds that I/O requests have waited on this block device. If there are multiple I/O requests waiting, this value will increase as the product of the number of milliseconds times the number of requests waiting
panels.title: Max I/O Queue wait time

panels.description: mmap: 	The amount of memory used for mapped files (includes tmpfs/shmem)
panels.title: Memory Mapped File  Usage

panels.description:
hot:  The amount of working set memory, this includes recently accessed memory,  dirty memory, and kernel memory. 

swap: The amount of swap currently used by the processes in this cgroup
mmap: 	The amount of memory used for mapped files (includes tmpfs/shmem)

cache:  Number of bytes of page cache memory.
panels.title: Swap Memory Usage
